sen.j: 一上（いちのかみ）とは、筆頭の公卿（一ノ上卿）という意味で、通常は左大臣のことを指す。
sen.e: Ichinokami is the top of Kugyo (the top court officials), usually Sadaijin (minister of the left).
Ichinokami was the top of Kugyo (the top court officials), usually Sadaijin (minister of the left).
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Ichinokami was the head of the Kugyo (top court officials) and usually referred to the Minister of the Left.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 天皇の師傳である太政大臣と天皇の代理である摂政関白を除いた公卿の中で最高の地位にある大臣がこれを務めた。
sen.e: The highest-ranking minister among the Kugyo except for Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state), who received direct instructions by the emperor, and Sessho Kanpaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor), who would act for the emperor, served as ichinokami.

The highest-ranking minister among the Kugyo except for Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state), who received direct instructions from the Emperor, and Sessho Kanpaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor), who would act for the Emperor, served as ichinokami.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: The Ichinokami was the highest-ranking minister among the Kugyo, except for Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state), who received direct instructions from the Emperor, and Sessho Kanpaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor), who acted for the Emperor.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: すなわち、通常は左大臣が務めるが、もしも左大臣が欠員もしくは摂政関白を兼ねる（一上資格がない）場合には右大臣が任じられることになっていた。
sen.e: Sadaijin usually served as ichinokami, however, in the case where the position of Sadaijin was vacant or Sadaijin served concurrently as Sessho Kanpaku (Sessho Kanpaku was not qualified as ichinokami), Udaijin (minister of the right) was appointed as ichinokami.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sadaijin usually served as ichinokami, however, in the case where the position of Sadaijin was vacant or Sadaijin served concurrently as Sessho Kanpaku (Sessho Kanpaku was not qualified as ichinokami), Udaijin (minister of the right) was appointed as ichinokami.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) usually served as ichinokami, however, in the case where the position of Sadaijin was vacant or Sadaijin served concurrently as Sessho Kanpaku (Sessho Kanpaku was not qualified as ichinokami), Udaijin (minister of the right) was appointed as ichinokami.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: それも不可能な場合には内大臣が任じられることになっていた（極稀に大納言が任命される例も存在はする）。
sen.e: Otherwise, Naidaijin (minister) was appointed as ichinokami (in most rare cases, Dainagon (Major Counselor) was appointed as ichinokami).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Otherwise, Naidaijin (minister) was appointed as ichinokami (in the most rare case, Dainagon (Major Counselor) was appointed as ichinokami).
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Otherwise, Naidaijin (minister) was appointed as ichinokami; and very occasionally the Dainagon (Major Counselor) was appointed as ichinokami.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: また、一上は蔵人別当を兼務して蔵人頭以下の蔵人を指揮し、陰陽寮別当が設置された場合にはこれも兼務した。
sen.e: In addition, ichinokami led Kurodo (Chamberlain) under Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) by concurrently serving as Kurodo-betto (superintendent of Chamberlains), as well as Onmyo-ryo betto (superintendent of the Bureau of Divination) when set up.

In addition, ichinokami led Kurodo (Chamberlain) under Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) by concurrently serving as Kurodo-betto (superintendent of Chamberlains), as well as Onmyo-ryo betto (superintendent of the Bureau of Divination) when set up.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In addition, ichinokami were in charge of Kurodo (Chamberlains) other than the Head Chamberlain, as they served concurrently as Kurodo-betto (superintendent of Chamberlains), as well as Onmyo-ryo betto (superintendent of the Bureau of Divination).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: なお、一上任命の際には「一上宣旨」と呼ばれる勅宣が出されるのが通例であったが、一上であった左大臣が摂政関白に就任したことによって一上を退く場合には、後継の一上を指名する場合もあった。
sen.e: Incidentally, in appointing a person as ichinokami, an imperial decree called "ichinokami senshi" was usually issued, but in the case where Sadaijin resigned from ichinokami by taking the position of Sessho Kanpaku, Sadaijin occasionally appointed succeeding ichinokami.

Incidentally, in appointing a person as ichinokami, an imperial decree called "ichinokami senshi" was usually issued, but in the case where Sadaijin resigned from ichinokami by taking the position of Sessho Kanpaku, Sadaijin were occasionally appointed succeeding ichinokami.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Incidentally, an imperial decree was usually issued to appoint an Ichinokami however if a Sadaijin resigned from ichinokami by taking the position of Sessho Kanpaku, the Sadaijin occasionally appointed their successor.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 特殊なケースとして左大臣（一上）であった藤原道長が摂政就任によって一上を退く際には右大臣藤原顕光以下大納言以上の7人の公卿のうち、その日最も早く出勤した者がその日の一上職務を行うこととした例（『小右記』長和5年3月16日条）がある。
sen.e: An exceptional case was: when FUJIWARA no Michinaga, who served as Sadaijin (ichinokami), resigned from ichinokami by taking the position of Sessho (regent), he decided that a person who came in to work the earliest on the day would serve as ichinokami of the day among seven kugyo, who were in the position between Udaijin (FUJIWARA no Akimitsu) and Dainagon ("Shoyuki" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Sanesuke) March 16, 1016).

An exceptional case was: when FUJIWARA no Michinaga, who served as Sadaijin (ichinokami), resigned from ichinokami by taking the position of Sessho (regent), he decided that the person who came in to work the earliest on the day would serve as ichinokami for the day among the seven kugyo, who were in the position between Udaijin (FUJIWARA no Akimitsu) and Dainagon ("Shoyuki" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Sanesuke) March 16, 1016).
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: An exceptional case was when FUJIWARA no Michinaga, who served as Sadaijin and Ichinokami, resigned from the post of Ichinokami by taking the position of Sessho (regent), and he decided that the person who came in to work the earliest on the day would serve as ichinokami for the day among the seven kugyo, who were in the position between Udaijin (FUJIWARA no Akimitsu) and Dainagon (article of March 16, 1016, "Shoyuki" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Sanesuke)).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: これは顕光及び内大臣藤原公季が高齢で老耄の気があることを道長が気にかけたための対策であったという。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Michinaga was worried that Akimitsu and Naidaijin FUJIWARA no Kinsue were too old to serve as ichinokami and thus made such a decision.
FUJIWARA no Michinaga was worried that Akimitsu and Naidaijin FUJIWARA no Kinsue were too old to serve as ichinokami and thus made such a decision.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This was done because FUJIWARA no Michinaga was worried that Akimitsu and Naidaijin FUJIWARA no Kinsue were too old to serve as ichinokami.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 久安3年（1147年）、左右両大臣の不在によって一上となった藤原頼長が大いに政務の再興を図って、兄の摂政藤原忠通を圧倒している。
sen.e: In 1147, FUJIWARA no Yorinaga became ichinokami due to the vacancies of Ministers of the Right and the Left, and attempted to restore government affairs, thus overwhelming his brother, FUJIWARA no Tadamichi.

In 1147, FUJIWARA no Yorinaga became ichinokami due to the vacancies of Ministers of the Right and the Left, and attempted to restore government affairs, thus overwhelming his brother, FUJIWARA no Tadamichi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1147, FUJIWARA no Yorinaga became ichinokami due to the vacancies of Ministers of the Right and the Left, and attempted to restore government affairs, thus taking over power from his brother FUJIWARA no Tadamichi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。
